meanings.definition: To lower the head or body quickly to avoid a blow or missile.
meanings.sent1: She was ducking to dodge the ball thrown at her.
meanings.sent2: The child was ducking to avoid getting hit by the swinging branch.
meanings.sent3: The cat was ducking under the table to escape the playful puppy.
meanings.sent4: The ninja was ducking like a shadow to evade the enemy's attack.
meanings.sent5: He was ducking so fast, it seemed like he had vanished into thin air.

meanings.definition: To plunge the whole body or the head momentarily under water.
meanings.sent1: The duck was ducking into the pond for a swim.
meanings.sent2: The swimmer was ducking underwater to explore the coral reef.
meanings.sent3: The otter was ducking in and out of the water, playing a game of hide and seek.
meanings.sent4: The fish was ducking through the seaweed, searching for food.
meanings.sent5: She was ducking beneath the waves, feeling the cool ocean embrace.

meanings.definition: To avoid something by a sudden quick movement.
meanings.sent1: He was ducking to sidestep the flying ball.
meanings.sent2: The dancer was ducking gracefully to avoid colliding with her partner.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was ducking around the tree trunk to escape the curious cat.
meanings.sent4: The athlete was ducking and weaving through the obstacles in the race.
meanings.sent5: She was ducking skillfully, narrowly missing the falling object.
